result.execSummary:
The defendant CASIMIR AMANE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts within 60 days. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: IMPOSED with good time.  See below for credit for time served.

records.addlTxt: 11:03 AM Defendant CASIMIR AMANE in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Defendant CASIMIR AMANE in custody.  Tracy Ann Paider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties stipulate to Dr. report.  Court finds Defendant Competent to proceed.  State moves to amend information, placing plea agreement onto court record.  Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with.  Parties waive rights to PreSentence Investigation Report.

09:30 AM Defendant CASIMIR AMANE in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Defendant CASIMIR AMANE in custody.  Tracy Ann Paider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Patzer requests a competency exam be order for defendant.  No objection from the State.  Court will order competency evaluation.  Bond continues.

Court notes victim's rights are complied with.  Court orders bond to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
